intro: Erithalis diffusa, commonly known as the common erithalis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Erithalis diffusa is often found in moist, calcareous soils in woodland edges and stream banks.
